title: Top Gear, episode 4 review: rainbow cars balanced out that controversial trip to Brunei – but Chris Harris was missed
text:
Is it just me who has a sudden craving for strawberry-flavoured Angel Delight? Top Gear (BBC Two) found Paddy McGuinness whipping up the quintessentially British powdered dessert in some unlikely surroundings: on a raft in the Brunei jungle for a team of Gurkhas. They don’t get that from Joanna Lumley.

This penultimate episode of a short and punchy five-part series had hit the headlines ahead of its broadcast, thanks to two controversies.

The Brunei expedition was filmed in March, before the the south-east Asian country’s threat to make homosexuality and adultery punishable by stoning to death. Horrified by this news, McGuinness and co-host Freddie Flintoff earnestly explained how the production...
